page.p: This adventure is designed for four to five characters of 1st level. During the course of the adventure, the characters will advance to 3rd level.
The adventure takes place in and around the town of Millbrook, a small settlement on the edge of the Greenwood Forest.
This section explains how to run the adventure effectively.
Read through the entire adventure before running it so you understand the flow and can foreshadow events.
The Dungeon Master (DM) has a special role in the game.
The DM is a referee. When it's not clear what ought to happen next, the DM decides how to apply the rules and keep the story going.
The DM is a narrator. The DM sets the pace of the story and presents the various challenges and encounters the players must overcome.

boxed_text.p: As the Dungeon Master, you are the final authority when it comes to rules questions or disputes during the game.
When in doubt, make it up! It's better to keep the game moving than to get bogged down in the rules.
It's not a competition. The DM isn't competing against the player characters.

page.p: Three months ago, the merchant Marcus Thornwood discovered an ancient map leading to a lost treasure vault beneath the Old Mill ruins outside Millbrook.
Unfortunately, a band of goblins has taken up residence in the mill, and they've been raiding caravans on the East Road.
Marcus has hired the adventurers to clear out the goblins and find the entrance to the vault.
The Tavern Heist is divided into three parts.
In part 1, "The Crow's Nest Inn," the adventurers meet their patron Marcus at the local tavern and learn about the goblin threat.
In part 2, "The Old Mill," the characters investigate the ruined mill and confront the goblins.
Part 3, "The Vault Below," has the adventurers descend into the ancient vault to claim their reward.
The adventure uses terms that might be unfamiliar to you.

definition_item.definition: This term refers to the adventurers run by the players. They are the protagonists in any adventure.
This term refers to characters run by the DM. How an NPC behaves is dictated by the adventure and by the DM.
At various places, the adventure presents descriptive text that's meant to be read or paraphrased aloud to players.
Any monster or NPC that is likely to be involved in combat requires game statistics presented in a format called a statistics block.

page.p: The following abbreviations are used in this adventure.
The adventure begins when the characters arrive at the Crow's Nest Inn in Millbrook.

boxed_text.p: The wooden sign above the door depicts a crow perched on a tankard. Inside, the common room is warm and filled with the smell of roasting meat. A fire crackles in the hearth, and a half-dozen patrons sit at rough-hewn tables.

page.p: **Marcus Thornwood** is a middle-aged human merchant with graying temples and nervous hands. He offers the party 50 gp each to clear out the Old Mill.
**Ingrid the Innkeeper** is a stout dwarf woman who runs the Crow's Nest. She can tell the party that goblins have been spotted near the East Road.

list.item: **Easy (DC 10).** A character can learn the goblins have a leader.
**Moderate (DC 15).** The leader is bigger than the others, possibly a bugbear.
**Hard (DC 20).** The goblins came from the Greenwood three months ago.

page.p: The Old Mill lies two miles east of Millbrook along a dirt path.

boxed_text.p: The ruined mill stands at the edge of the forest. Its waterwheel hangs broken and still. Vines crawl up the crumbling stone walls, and the wooden roof has partially collapsed.

page.p: Two **goblins** stand guard at the entrance. They attack strangers on sight.
Three more **goblins** wait here, hiding behind overturned machinery.
The stairs creak dangerously. A character who searches the debris finds a small pouch containing 15 sp.
The **goblin boss** Snarltooth makes his lair here with two **wolves**.

page.p: Behind a hidden door in the basement, stone stairs descend into darkness.

boxed_text.p: The vault is a single chamber, fifty feet square. Ancient pillars support a vaulted ceiling. In the center, a stone chest sits on a raised dais.

page.p: The chest contains 200 gp, a *potion of healing*, and a *+1 dagger*.
When the characters return to Millbrook with news of their success, Marcus pays them as promised. The townsfolk celebrate the heroes at the Crow's Nest Inn.
